Cell.Data: The DEV TEAM / MISC NOTES column contains info on what text between { } signs means (if applicable). It usually stands for either a numeric value, or a numeric value with an icon. Text between [ ] signs stands for a certain type of icon.
This is the name of the wildlife race. Plural.
This is the name of the wildlife race. Singular.
This is the name of a unit.

"It was the first on the battlefield. This apostate fought with deadly cruelty. This enemy knew just where to strike our forces, exploiting our weakness each time we exposed our flanks. Its blade was forged from chaos itself, screaming as it struck with random effect—as though the blade itself refused to be a single weapon. Nothing else on the battlefield took as much joy from killing as did this adversary. An army composed of apostates would be a thing of nightmares. Proving that the enemy of my enemy is something far worse.”—General Charles Mainbee, “RV-0309225M: Lovers of Anarchy"

This is a unit description. I.e. a bit of flavor text about the unit that gives an insight into the lore of the game. This takes the form of a quote - from a book, diary, journal, etc - followed by the source. A lot of them try to get across some of the humor Triumph is known for.
The person of the quote is male
This is the name of a unit.

"King Lurien didn’t trust his oracle. She told the King to make peace, but he built an army. So he sought a Seer, but again was told to make peace. Desperate, he sought an Apostate chaos-witch Hagatha. She promised Lurien that, with her help, he would reign over every soul in the surrounding lands. Lurien agreed. The apostate rained chaos upon the land indiscriminately. The kingdom and its neighbors were decimated. It is said that Hagatha has a jar with Lurien’s eyes—all that endures of King Lurien and his ambition.”— Anthen Mantlebond, Storyteller, “RV-77737E: Fables of Blood and Chaos"

This is a unit description. I.e. a bit of flavor text about the unit that gives an insight into the lore of the game. This takes the form of a quote - from a book, diary, journal, etc - followed by the source. A lot of them try to get across some of the humor Triumph is known for.
The person of the quote is male
This is the name of a unit.

"Sir Jakob was a virtuous man, a Champion among the Oathbound. The people loved him, but the Seeress Mishell saw the seed of pride lodged deep within him. He was denied a continuance to don an Exemplar’s power armor. Jakob let his pride fester. He embraced chaos. Rather than suppressing chaos, he took her as his weapon. He stole the Exemplar’s mantle, and sundered the Seeress’s tower when she escaped his treachery. His legend warns Oathbound children to heed the Seers. For if you don’t, the Apostate Tyrant may come for you.”—Oathbound Fablemaster, Loray Kinbinder, “RV-7274298R: Path of Legends"

This is a unit description. I.e. a bit of flavor text about the unit that gives an insight into the lore of the game. This takes the form of a quote - from a book, diary, journal, etc - followed by the source. A lot of them try to get across some of the humor Triumph is known for.
The person of the quote is female
